questions.question_text: The Report Designer contains different sections for configuring your report. Which section is used to specify grouping and calculations to be run against the data?

discussion.content:
C.
https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/courses/washingtondc/app_store_learnv2_reportanalytics_washingtondc_reporting_and_analytics/app_store_learnv2_reportanalytics_washingtondc_data_visualization/app_store_learnv2_reportanalytics_washingtondc_viewrun_reports

Selected Answer: C
Based on SN ebook pg 267

Answer is C. https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/courses/tokyo/app_store_learnv2_reportanalytics_tokyo_reporting_and_analytics/app_store_learnv2_reportanalytics_tokyo_data_visualization/app_store_learnv2_reportanalytics_tokyo_configuring_reports

Answer is C. Configure.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-now-intelligence/page/use/reporting/reference/aggregation-reporting.html

There are only 4 sections and they are DATA, TYPE, CONFIGURE, and STYLE. And Group by do not include calculations Aggregation does. Both Group by and Aggregation are both under the Configure section therefore making C. Configure the answer.
The answer is the Configure section. The data section does not provide any of what the question is asking. Group by is not a section its a subsection under Configure.
Answer is B, I checked it on my instance
I think B. Group by should be the correct answer...
I think B. Grouop by should be the correct answer...

questions.question_text: What icon do you use to change the icon and color on a Favorite?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Star selects the favorite and pencil edits the favorite

Selected Answer: D
Is this not by using the star Icon and clicking on "more". There I saw the color and icon options.
B is correct

questions.question_text: You have heard about a new application released by ServiceNow. You want to try it out, to see if it might be useful for your company's ServiceNow implementation. What would be the best way to get hands-on experience with the new application?

choices.E: Click Funnel icon, type Hardware and click enter
choices.D: On Breadcrumb, click > icon, type Hardware and click enter
choices.C: On the list, locate and right click on the value Hardware, select Show Matching
choices.A: On the Category column header, right click and select Show > Hardware
choices.B: Right click on magnifier, type Hardware and click enter

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Show matching

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C
C is correct

questions.question_text: When looking at a long list of records, you want to quickly filter, to show only those which have Category of Hardware. How might you do that?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
%email - returns records with short description ending with email
*email - returns records with short description that contains word email

Selected Answer: D
A, C, and D are all correct. It just depends on whether you are looking for email as a standalone word or combined with another word. But all (A, C, D) are correct. The question indicates it wants you to pull any records where the word email is contained. In that case (again technically) D is the most correct.

Selected Answer: C
It's C. With the short description you can't do "show matching" as in the previous question, you need to search for records that have the word "e-mail" in the short description. and this is done by searching "*e-mail" (wildcard e-mail) in the Short Description column.
C is correct

choices.C: Click List Magnifier to expand column search, on Short Description, type *email, click enter
choices.D: Click List Magnifier to expand column search, on Short Description, type %email, click enter
choices.A: Click List Magnifier to expand column search, on Short Description, type email, click enter
choices.B: On Search box, select text, type email, click enter

questions.question_text: When looking at a long list of records, you want to quickly filter, to show only those which have Short Description containing email. How might you do that?
